thread.title: Pekin hosts VB regional as playoffs begin
thread.title_full: Pekin hosts VB regional as playoffs begin

author: Times Staff
title: Pekin hosts VB regional as playoffs begin
text: Pekin hosts VB regional as playoffs begin Comment Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 9:39 PM PEKIN, ILL The Dawson Hawkins Gym will be the site of the Pekin Regional in the IHSA Class 4A volleyball postseason. The Dragons (21-13, 8-6) will kick off action tomorrow night at 7 p.m. against Springfield High School. The Dragons are coming off of a fourth-place finish in the Mid-Illini Conference this year. Yvonne Thompson’s squad set a team record for Mid-Illini victories this season with eight conference wins. The regional kicks off tonight at 6 p.m. as Rock Island takes on East Moline. The winner of that game will match up with the regional’s top seed Bloomington High School tomorrow night at 6 p.m.. A win for the Dragons would set up a 6 p.m. Thursday match-up against the winner of the Bloomington High School vs. Rock Island/Moline match. 3A Olympia kicks off their postseason tonight at the Lincoln Regional when they play Clinton at 6 p.m.. A victory would set the Spartans up to play Lincoln tomorrow night at 6 p.m.. Also in the Lincoln Regional, the Morton Potters will face the Metamora Redbirds tomorrow night at 7 p.m. Washington High School will also host a IHSA Class 3A volleyball Regional. Prairie Central is set to take on Pontiac tonight at 6 p.m.. The winner of that match-up will face Washington tomorrow night at 7 p.m. The East Peoria Raiders will battle Streator tonight at 7 p.m. at the Washington Regional. If East Peoria were to advance they would play Normal University tomorrow night at 7 p.m. 2A The Farmington Regional begins tonight with Illini Bluffs taking on Toulon at 6 p.m.. A victory for Illini Bluffs would set them up to face off with Eureka tomorrow night at 6 p.m. Midwest Central will host a regional that will see three local teams in action. Midwest Central will square off with Havana at 6 p.m. to get the regional started. Tremont will follow up tonight at 7 p.m. in a face-off with Illini Central. Dee-Mack, the top seed in the regional, awaits the winner of Midwest Central vs. Havana. That match will begin at 6 p.m. tomorrow. Tremont hopes to advance tonight to face off with Rushville Industry tomorrow at 7 p.m. 1A Delavan travels to Roanoke Benson tonight to face off with Peoria Heights at 6 p.m.. The advancing team will face off against Hartsburg tomorrow at 6 p.m.
